info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-rfid-cfg
info.description:
This module contains a collection of YANG
     definitions for configuration of rfid.
     Copyright (c) 2017-2019, 2022 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

**Configuration Module**
**Module:** `Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-rfid-cfg`
**Paths:** 2

**📊 YANG Tree:** [View Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-rfid-cfg structure](https://jeremycohoe.github.io/cisco-ios-xe-openapi-swagger/yang-trees/Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-rfid-cfg.html)

get.description:
This subtype is used for setting
       notify threshold timer

put.description:
Create or replace This subtype is used for setting
       notify threshold timer

patch.description:
Partially modify This subtype is used for setting
       notify threshold timer

delete.description:
Delete This subtype is used for setting
       notify threshold timer

get.description:
This is the typedef which holds all the
         rfid config attributes.

put.description:
Create or replace This is the typedef which holds all the
         rfid config attributes.

patch.description:
Partially modify This is the typedef which holds all the
         rfid config attributes.

delete.description:
Delete This is the typedef which holds all the
         rfid config attributes.

rfid-enable-bluesoft.description:
Rfid enable bluesoft represents whether bluesoft tag supported or not.
         If enable state then bluesoft tag is supported and if disable state then bluesoft
         tag not supported

rfid-timeout.description: Rfid timeout represents the timeout value to cleanup stale rfid entries.

rfid-enable-cisco.description:
Rfid enable Cisco represents whether Cisco tag rfid supported or not.
         If enable state then Cisco tag is supported and if disable state then Cisco
         tag not supported

rfid-rssi-expiry.description: Rfid rssi expiry time represents to cleanup rfid rssi when rssi value expires.

rfid-rssi-halflife.description:
Rfid rssi halflife represents half life when averaging
         two RSSI readings for RFID tags,
         timeout value zero indicates that timeout is disabled.

rfid-notify-threshold.description:
Rfid notify threshold indicates LOCP notification
         threshold for RSSI measurements.

rfid-enable-bluesoft.description:
Rfid enable bluesoft represents whether bluesoft tag supported or not.
         If enable state then bluesoft tag is supported and if disable state then bluesoft
         tag not supported

rfid-timeout.description: Rfid timeout represents the timeout value to cleanup stale rfid entries.

rfid-enable-cisco.description:
Rfid enable Cisco represents whether Cisco tag rfid supported or not.
         If enable state then Cisco tag is supported and if disable state then Cisco
         tag not supported

rfid-rssi-expiry.description: Rfid rssi expiry time represents to cleanup rfid rssi when rssi value expires.

rfid-rssi-halflife.description:
Rfid rssi halflife represents half life when averaging
         two RSSI readings for RFID tags,
         timeout value zero indicates that timeout is disabled.

rfid-notify-threshold.description:
Rfid notify threshold indicates LOCP notification
         threshold for RSSI measurements.

rfid.description:
This is the typedef which holds all the
         rfid config attributes.

Rfid enable bluesoft represents whether bluesoft tag supported or not.
         If enable state then bluesoft tag is supported and if disable state then bluesoft

Rfid enable Cisco represents whether Cisco tag rfid supported or not.
         If enable state then Cisco tag is supported and if disable state then Cisco
